Yes, his roar is the equivalent of what one would feel after the initial bo=
om of a thunderhead .  It would be projected as a wave of energy over a cer=
tain radius.  The lightning symbolizes light which reflects off of Tucson's=
 shimmering silver armor as it bounces off the draconic scales.  It isn't a=
 weapon it's just how the light touches his armor due to the brilliance of =
his silver plating.  Call it a visual aesthetic.  I hope this helps.

Perpe=
tually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Sep 17, 2011, at 5:55 PM, Supe=
r Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> I am in agreement with Airly=
. I could see the ground thing in that
> much like a loud sound could rattl=
e your chest, like at a conscert and
> you can feel the beat in your chest.=
 But what do you mean by flashes
> of lightning?
> 
> Just making sure I ha=
ve a clear understanding before I have a clear
> understanding. Tuscon's so=
nic roar could be as loud as thunder and
> even perhaps sound like it, but =
would not be thunder in the sense of
> being part of the weather patterns.
=
> 
> For instance nearby thunder can range as loud as 120 Db. For
> referen=
ces: This is roughly the equivalent to being within 200 feet of
> a jet air=
craft during take-off or about 3 feet from an auto horn. A
> chain saw is r=
ated around 100 decibels. A sound of 140 decibels is
> painfully loud. [Not=
e each 10 decibel increase in noise level seems
> twice as loud.]
> 
> I wo=
uld imagine that Tuscon is probrably like Brawl in this matter,
> but more =
effective in its use, meaning he can hit at almost 300 Db if
> conscentrate=
d into a blast, probrably 200 in a cone and 150 in a wave.
> 
> 300 (BEAM) =
can blow out metal and concrete and such like. Basically as
> powerful as a=
ny blast Megatron, Gavatron, Optimus Prime, Rodimus or
> any other leader t=
ype can deliver. It is just created from Sonic
> energies rather than more =
conventional energies.
> 
> 200 (CONE) Could concievably kill a human and p=
robrably cause serious
> damage on some of the sensative inner workings of =
a transformer. Could
> do things like blow out glass and other unprotected =
crystalized
> materials.
> 
> 150 (CIRCLE) Painfully loud and POSSIBLY stun=
ning affects.
> 
> Here is a list of Db counts. I cannot say I would follow=
 it
> religiously, since this is a Scifi settings and the transformers are
=
> not human, but it would give you an idea and could spark creativity.
> Ho=
wever some things may not work exactly as planned. So if you are
> going to=
 try something special, PLEASE talk it over with me first.
> 
> http://www.=
makeitlouder.com/Decibel%20Level%20Chart.txt
> 
> I hope all this gives foo=
d for thought.
> 
> - Preston
>

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Yes, his roar is the equivalent of wha=
t one would feel after the initial boom of a thunderhead .  It would b=
e projected as a wave of energy over a certain radius.  The lightning =
symbolizes light which reflects off of Tucson's shimmering silver armor as =
it bounces off the draconic scales.  It isn't a weapon it's just how t=
he light touches his armor due to the brilliance of his silver plating. &nb=
sp;Call it a visual aesthetic.  I hope this helps.<br><br>Perpetually =
on the move and constantly busy. </div><div><br>On Sep 17, 2011, at 5:=

yclonus@...</a>> wrote:<br><br></div><div></div><blockquote type=

id=3D"ygrp-text">
      
      
      <p>I am in agreement with Airly. I co=
uld see the ground thing in that<br>
much like a loud sound could rattle yo=
ur chest, like at a conscert and<br>
you can feel the beat in your chest. B=
ut what do you mean by flashes<br>
of lightning?<br>
<br>
Just making sure =
I have a clear understanding before I have a clear<br>
understanding. Tusco=
n's sonic roar could be as loud as thunder and<br>
even perhaps sound like =
it, but would not be thunder in the sense of<br>
being part of the weather =
patterns.<br>
<br>
For instance nearby thunder can range as loud as 120 Db.=
 For<br>
references: This is roughly the equivalent to being within 200 fee=
t of<br>
a jet aircraft during take-off or about 3 feet from an auto horn. =
A<br>
chain saw is rated around 100 decibels. A sound of 140 decibels is<br=
>
painfully loud. [Note each 10 decibel increase in noise level seems<br>
t=
wice as loud.]<br>
<br>
I would imagine that Tuscon is probrably like Brawl=
 in this matter,<br>
but more effective in its use, meaning he can hit at a=
lmost 300 Db if<br>
conscentrated into a blast, probrably 200 in a cone and=
 150 in a wave.<br>
<br>
300 (BEAM) can blow out metal and concrete and suc=
h like. Basically as<br>
powerful as any blast Megatron, Gavatron, Optimus =
Prime, Rodimus or<br>
any other leader type can deliver. It is just created=
 from Sonic<br>
energies rather than more conventional energies.<br>
<br>
2=
00 (CONE) Could concievably kill a human and probrably cause serious<br>
da=
mage on some of the sensative inner workings of a transformer. Could<br>
do=
 things like blow out glass and other unprotected crystalized<br>
materials=
.<br>
<br>
150 (CIRCLE) Painfully loud and POSSIBLY stunning affects.<br>
<=
br>
Here is a list of Db counts. I cannot say I would follow it<br>
religio=
usly, since this is a Scifi settings and the transformers are<br>
not human=
, but it would give you an idea and could spark creativity.<br>
However som=
e things may not work exactly as planned. So if you are<br>
going to try so=
mething special, PLEASE talk it over with me first.<br>
